column5: Did this to my favourite prop one night last year on Chemong Lake. What I need to know if its repairable and if so - is it worth doing?  If not, I want to get a new one the same size as it gives me about 5 mph more then the one I have on the boat now. Here are the pictures:                 If its repairable - can someone recommend someone to do it  Thanks   Don
Don,  no pics are showing...  if you neeed a hand pm me.  Gerritt.
Our resident Prop expert is still in the hospital.. I believe ! GaryV
Tracker it can be fixed ...im a Prop drop off if you need it fixed ..
Don, there a place called the "Prop Drop" on hwy 35 just south of the 35/7 intersection.
Wow - you guys are fast - thanks.  Steve - what do you figure it costs - ball park - would never hold you to a price from a picture   Don
Dax - I know that place! - not to far from my trailer in Fowlers Corners  Don
That's where I take all mine. Good guy, good service. he doesn't do the work there, but ships them out to Kawartha props........I've always had good service with them.  Sinker
It cost me $60 for a prop off a 40 hp, re built, and balanced. He has one of mine right  now.  Sinker
Thanks guys!  Steve - I'll try to get it into you in Dunnville to have a look at it.  How long does it take to get fixed? ( approx. )
a local shop here in sudbury last year was doing it for 25 bucks per blade, balanced and painted, and if you leave a deposit he'll give u a loaner, but it would cost u more in gas to get here
Water is down 6"-8" on Chemong compareed to "normal" levels.  Too bad you found out the hard way.  Hope it's a cheap, quick fix.
If I may and nothing against the rebuilders,whats a new one worth? True and blue to run true, out of the box,also,ever thought of going SS?  Man thats nasty.
